meta_description: Explore SJIMA in Friday Harbor, a hub for art and culture in the San Juan Islands.
hours_text:
Getting Here

# Plan Your Visit

Your San Juan Islands Museum of Art experience begins the moment you start your journey to Friday Harbor. Whether you travel by sky or sea to get here, you'll start by taking in the breathtaking beauty of the San Juan Islands archipelago.

Museum Hours

## San Juan Islands Museum of Art  
540 Spring Street  
Friday Harbor, WA 98250  
360-370-5050

#### HOURS:

June 19 - September 11

Thursday to Monday 11 a.m. – 5 p.m.

​

September 12 - June 18

Friday to Monday 11 a.m. – 5 p.m.

Admissions Info

WASHINGTON STATE FERRIES

The ferry between Anacortes, WA, and San Juan Island/Friday Harbor accommodates a car or walk-on service. Either way you choose to travel, the ferry trip is a beautiful sightseeing experience on a 75-minute sail. There are multiple sailings per day and the WSF Save A Spot reservation system makes it easy to book vehicle reservations, which is recommended.

[Learn More ](https://wsdot.wa.gov/travel/washington-state-ferries)

KENMORE AIR

Flights offer convenience, flat rates, and timeliness connection to San Juan Island. Kenmore Air offers daily, roundtrip flights from Paine Field in Everett, WA, to the San Juan Islands

​

Seattle/Boeing Field to Friday Harbor Airport  
Four daily flights | 40-minute air time

​

Everett/Paine Field to Friday Harbor Airport  
Four daily flights | 25-minute air time

[Learn More ](https://kenmoreair.com/friday-harbor/)

VISITOR GUIDELINES

Here are some tips to get the most out of your visit ...

collections_text:
[2025-26 Artists' Registry Show: Kelly O'Dell](https://www.sjima.org/exhibitions/upper-left%3A-landscapes-of-the-pacific-northwest)

###### Visual Arts & Programming that spark Reflection, Discovery, Inspiration & Connection

currentExhibitions

# Current Exhibition

December 12, 2025 - February 23, 2026

###### Nichols, North, and Atrium Galleries

#### Artists' Registry Show

Join us for the annual Artists’ Registry Show featuring artists from across San Juan County!

More than 100 emerging and established artists’ works fill the galleries of the San Juan Islands Museum of Art. The scope of their creations includes sculpture, textiles, painting, glass, woodwork, printmaking, pastels, photography, metalwork, drawing, encaustic, pottery, mixed media, assemblage, digital art, jewelry and more.

###### [from top left] Moonlight Encounter, Nancy Spaulding (San Juan Island); A Matter of Time, Bryn Barnard (Lopez Island).  
[from bottom left] Umbel Floret II, Diana Friend (Stuart Island); Tidepool, Kelly O'Dell (Lopez Island).

AR-interviews

Discover the Artists Behind the Work

In this special interview compilation, 20 local artists reflect on their materials, process, inspirations, and the ideas behind their artwork—standing in front of the very pieces featured in this year’s exhibition. Together, these short interviews offer an intimate, behind-the-scenes look at the creativity, craft, and lived experience that shape the Artists’ Registry Show.

​​
